sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King a proclamation for quieting the Post-master General, his deputies and assigns in the execution of his office. England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Re-printed by the heir of Andrew Anderson, printer to his most sacred Majesty, Edinburgh : Anno Dom. 1685.
Caption title. Imprint from colophon. With royal coat of arms at head of text. Dated at end: Given at Our Court at Windsor, the seventh day of September, 1685. In the first year of Our Reign. Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland. Proclamation exempting postmasters from having to accommodate soldiers on their premises and from serving on juries.
=======
By the King a proclamation for quieting the Post-master General, his deputies and assigns in the execution of his office. England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Re-printed by the heir of Andrew Anderson, printer to his most sacred Majesty, Edinburgh : Anno Dom. 1685.
Caption title. Imprint from colophon. With royal coat of arms at head of text. Dated at end: Given at Our Court at Windsor, the seventh day of September, 1685. In the first year of Our Reign. Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland. Proclamation exempting postmasters from having to accommodate soldiers on their premises and from serving on juries.
his most sacred Majesty
the heir of Andrew Anderson
